listing.name: Card Size by Screenful
listing.description:
[Card Size by Screenful](https://screenful.com/card-size-for-trello/?utm_campaign=card_size_pul&utm_source=card_size_pu) is a **free Power-Up** that allows you to set weights (e.g. hours or story points) for your cards to estimate how much work each card requires. The estimate is shown in the card front. It’s a simple board utility that is free and runs entirely within the Trello UI. 

**Features**

- **Set weights** for your cards to estimate required work
- **See totals** by card assignee, label or list 
- Control information visibility on **card front and back**

**Card Size Power Up in action**



![Card Size Power Up animation](https://app.screenful.me/integrations/trello-card-size/cardsize_animation_small.gif)

 ---
   
**It's free so you can just add it to your board**. Learn more about [Card Size by Screenful](https://screenful.com/card-size-for-trello?utm_source=trello&utm_campaign=card_size_pu) and see also [our other free Power-Ups!](https://screenful.com/power-ups?utm_source=trello&utm_campaign=card_size_pu)
listing.overview: Set weights (e.g. hours or story points) for your cards to estimate how much work each card requires.

listing.name: Clockify Integration for Trello
listing.description:
About
----------------

Clockify integration for Trello is an easy way to operate with time tracker inside a Trello board. You don't need to have any browser extension anymore to make it work.

---

Features
----------------

- Just copy-paste your Clockify API Token and you are ready to go.
- Start/stop timer inside a Trello card
- Update time entry description or easily append a checklist item to it.
- Select workspace, project, tags, billing options before the start
- Showing a badge about running timer on the front of card
- Basic work-log functionality

---

Price
----------------

Annual billing:  _4€/year_ for one board with unlimited members (5 days trial).

---

Support
----------------

If you have any feature suggestions or run into any problems, please get in touch with me by sending an email to tkostiushko@sm-act.com

---

Screenshots
----------------
[![Screenshot 1](https://trello-clockify.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/screen1.png)](https://trello-clockify.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/screen1.png)

listing.description:

**Features**

- **Create a card hierarchy** by assigning subtasks to cards
- Group cards into logical themes **across all your boards**
- Easily **find cards that are related**
- **See the progress of your work** across multiple boards

listing.name: GitHub
listing.description:
The GitHub Power-Up for Trello let’s teams track everything that’s going on in GitHub directly from their Trello boards.  Bring perspective to your codebase by attaching pull requests, issues, branches, and more directly to their respective cards.  In a glance, see whether a PR has been merged, the status of checks, who’s assigned to a PR, and more. Checks will also display as visual badges on the front of cards color coded to their status.

- Attach branches, commits, issues and pull requests directly to cards.
- See the status of pull requests on the front of cards.
- Identify cards that have not passed their checks with color coded badges that display on the front of cards.
- Developers and managers can easily jump into GitHub to work on assigned tasks in a single click.
- Associate one or more GitHub repositories with a board.
- The GitHub Power-Up supports both GitHub and GitHub Enterprise instances.

![screenshot](https://github.trello.services/images/screenshots/GitHub_1.jpg)
![screenshot](https://github.trello.services/images/screenshots/GitHub_2.jpg)
![screenshot](https://github.trello.services/images/screenshots/GitHub_3.jpg)
listing.overview: Attach branches, commits, issues, & pull requests to cards, and see the status of pull requests on your boards.

listing.name: Dependencies Graph
listing.description:
# Start managing dependencies like a ninja!
Defining dependencies between cards has never been so easy. Check how the Dependency Graph can change the way you work with tasks on Trello. **And best of all - it's all free and unlimited**

---

## What makes a Dependency Graph special?
### View dependencies as a graph
![Graph View](https://trello-dependecies-graph.web.app/static/graph.jpg)
Thanks to the Graph View, you can see the full picture of the dependencies on your board at any time. Locate tasks that need to be resolved first as they block the largest number of cards. In addition, card statuses are marked with colors (todo / inprogress / done). For easier conversations with colleagues, the cards are also numbered and you can easily see the assigned person and card labels.

---
### Define dependencies with one mouse click
![Graph View](https://trello-dependecies-graph.web.app/static/define.gif)
You can easily define new dependencies in the graph view. Just hold shift and draw an arrow from card to card with your mouse. No more tedious searching when defining relationships! Need to remove a dependency? Just select a line in the graph and press delete on your keyboard.

---
### Adjust the view to your needs
![Graph View](https://trello-dependecies-graph.web.app/static/filter.gif)
Your board has many columns and dozens of cards? Are you worried that the graph will be unreadable? With the help comes the function of filtering cards by columns. You can also choose whether you prefer a tree view or a circular view.

---

### Always keep an eye on dependencies
With Dependencies Graph you always see the relationships between cards. It doesn't matter if you're in graph view, looking at the board, or reading card details. Dependencies Graph will always provide you with the information you need.

**Graph view**
![Graph View](https://trello-dependecies-graph.web.app/static/see_graph.jpg)

**Details of the card**
![Graph View](https://trello-dependecies-graph.web.app/static/see_details.jpg)

**Board view**
![Graph View](https://trello-dependecies-graph.web.app/static/see_board.jpg)

---

### Stay up to date with active blockers
![Graph View](https://trello-dependecies-graph.web.app/static/wow.gif)
In the Power-Up settings, define which columns on your board you treat as completed tasks. Thanks to this, the Dependencies Graph will know when the card stops blocking other tasks. You don't have to manually mark dependencies as done - everything happens by itself!

------
## Pricing
None! The add-on is free and does not require registration. No catches!
listing.overview: Define dependencies between cards as a graph!

listing.name: Smart Fields
listing.description:
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Hand%20writing%20intro2.gif)
# Custom Fields on steroids. Harness the power of Javascript in Trello


---
## Get Started with templates
The best way to start with Smart Fields is to check out these templates we have prepared for you:

- [Sales Funnel](https://trello.com/b/5f2864ebfaa29076439b398a/vitalyandr/recommend) 
- [Inventory Management](https://trello.com/b/5f294cfce3d6b4341ee15257/vitalyandr/recommend) 
- [Advanced Project Budgeting and Time Tracking](https://trello.com/b/5f2967cb7c99c5788da38d8e/vitalyandr/recommend) 
- [Date conversion and Calculations using Formulas](https://trello.com/b/5f71f50158a0f13a64b278ea)

To explore these templates in action please create a board from template, read the description of the board to understand workflow and click on Smart fields board button to see the fields and formulas setup.

#Create fields
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Create%20fields_.gif)

---
# Use formulas, similar to Excel
Simple but powerful formula editor for all your business needs. We designed it with a straightforward goal in mind: **Simple things should be simple, complex things should be possible**. If you used Excel before you know formulas but **you can go further with the help of Javascript**.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/formulas2.png)

To accumulate values create the formula as in the animation below
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Formulas%20Accumulate%20values.gif)

---
# Show useful information in the list title
Sum, Average, Min, Max
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/list%20totals.gif)

---
#Sort cards in the list by field's values

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/list%20sorters.gif)
---
# Customize the field's appearance
Choose where and how the fields are displayed.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Customize%20fields%20appearence%202.gif)

---
# Track all the changes
Easily see who changed what when.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/history.png)

---
# Convenient data entry
Configure certain fields as read-only or hidden. Prepopulate with initial data and more.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/data-entry.png)

---
# Export SmartFields data from Trello to Excel
Take the data from SmartFields into Excel for further analysis, reports, charts, etc.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/export-csv.png)

---
## Watch the full demo now or start using Smart Fields

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/SmartFieldsDemov2.gif)

---

**FREE PLAN:**

- Single field - no monthly limit of field value changes
- Multiple fields - Fully functional 
Monthly limit of 10 field value changes. On each board, limits are waived for the first two weeks.
- Unlimited number of users

**PRO PLAN:**

- $4.99/month for each board
- Multiple fields
- Unlimited field value changes
- Unlimited number of users

**Save with Annual Pro Plan**

- 2 boards included
- $49,99/year
- Each additional board $11,99/year



![](https://calc.smartfieldsfortrello.com/landing_page)
listing.overview: Custom Fields on steroids - Use formulas to update Trello cards just like in Excel!

listing.name: Swimlanes by Blue Cat
listing.description:
Finally! The Swimlanes you always wanted for your Trello Boards.

Not only is Swimlanes by Blue Cat **free**, but it is also the only swim lanes tool to work with [Trello custom fields](https://www.bluecatreports.com/blog/trello-custom-fields-how-to-and-examples/) as well their Labels and Members.

Swimlanes is built by the team behind [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat), check out our other Power-Ups below.

## What are swimlanes?

Swimlanes create a view of your Trello boards which looks like the same board shown multiple times stacked on top of itself. Each board only has specific cards, for example, if you group by member each board only shows cards assigned to one member.

![Trello Swimlanes by Member](https://swimlanes.bluecatreports.com/listing/swimlanes.gif)

This is a great way to get an overview of where each team member's work is at in your process. Likewise, grouping by Label or Custom Field can show other useful overviews of your team's cards.

## How to show swimlanes in Trello
Here is how to add swimlanes to your Trello Boards

1. Add the Swimlanes by Blue Cat Power-Up to your Trello board
1. Open the Swimlanes view by clicking the Swimlanes button a the top of your board
1. Select how you want to group cards for your swim lanes from the dropdown in the top right
1. You can group your swim lanes by Label, Member or any custom dropdown or short text field

## How to use swimlanes

Swimlanes are a great way of visualising work in Trello which goes beyond the simple Trello board view. 

### Group by Member to get an overview of everyone's work

By grouping by member you can easily see where each team member's workload is on the board. Have they got enough/too-much work coming up? Have they got too much in progress already?

### Group by Custom Field to see your process with your data

If you have a custom field for **Priority**, easily see where each priorities work is in your process.  

Using a **Status** custom field? Then easily see a breakdown of work by status for your boards.

If you track **Epics** or **Projects** as custom fields you can group by those and see how each epic/project is progressing on your board. This is great for showing as part of a progress report as it lets people easily see progress against these higher-level objectives using the data from your Trello boards.

Interested in more powerful custom field reporting options? Including email reports sent right o your inbox? Then do check out the best reporting tool for Trello [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)
 
### Drag and Drop between swimlanes

You can even drag and drop cards within the swimlanes view. Doing this lets you add and remove members or labels, and update custom field values. You can also drag between lists just as you would in Trello.

## Our other Power-Ups

### [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)

Our Reporting Power-Up is the number one reporting tool for Trello. There is a fully-featured 7-day free trial so give it a go and see the sort of reports you can create now all your data is in Trello. You can [check it out here](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat).

### [Forms by Blue Cat](https://trello.com/power-ups/6139de588901011c01baf52f/forms-by-blue-cat)

Do you need a way for people to fill out forms and get cards created in Trello? Then look no further. Our [Forms Power-Up](https://trello.com/power-ups/6139de588901011c01baf52f/forms-by-blue-cat) does just that, integrates with all the standard and custom Trello fields as well as attachments. 

### [Import to Trello by Blue Cat](https://trello.com/power-ups/61fa6cd2cc14647c2c9ee821/trello-import-by-blue-cat)

Easily import CSV, Excel and Google Sheets into Trello with our FREE [Imports Power-Up](https://trello.com/power-ups/61fa6cd2cc14647c2c9ee821/import-to-trello-by-blue-cat-csv-excel)

## Our Trello guides

See our guide to [all the free Trello power-ups](https://www.bluecatreports.com/free-trello-powerups/)

Check out our reviews of [all the Trello reporting power-ups](https://www.bluecatreports.com/trello-reporting/)
listing.overview: Swimlanes for your Trello Boards, group cards by Label, Member, Custom Fields and more😻FREE😻

listing.name: Amazing Fields
listing.description:
![Status](https://api.amazingpowerups.com/api/status/amazing-fields)

---

🎖️ [Awarded](https://www.bluecatreports.com/blog/power-up-stats-2021/) #1 New Trello PowerUp of 2021!!
🚀 [Awarded](https://www.bluecatreports.com/blog/power-up-stats-2022/) Fastest growing PowerUp of 2022!!

👉🏼 Add extra data, styling, custom formats, and formula calculations with the Trello free and paid plans.

🔎 Want a substitute for the old Custom Fields powerup on the free plan, this is it.

----

**All the options you always wanted for extra card data but didn’t know to ask**

As a long time users of Trello, I wanted to break out of the limits of the standard cards and limited data options.  I wanted all the features I have grown to expect from other tools like **formulas**, **customized formatting**, **conditional styling**, **selectable icons**, **easy exports**, and even **progress bars**. I built this powerup to meet my needs and yours as well.

---

**Join 1000's of happy users**

"_I can't believe there aren't more apps that offer these features -- so well done and thank you so much for developing this!!_" - **Cathi B**

"This is one of the best powerups on Trello I have found in my last 10+ years of using Trello boards. Simply Amazing!!!" - **Yogesh B**

"Your Power Up is awesome! It should be named Awesome Fields!!" - **Gisele P**

---

![Overview Image](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amazing_fields_overall_guide.png)

It includes everything you could want:

   * **Text fields** - collect key information that you need for each card.
   * **Numbers** - track metrics like story points, counts, or any other numbers
   * **Checkbox** - support tracking any on/off style values
   * **Dates** - collect key dates and times to show on the cards
   * **Dropdown** - create a list of preset values and let users choose one or multiple
   * **Formulas** - calculate the value of fields from other field values
   * **Card References** - allow cards reference cards on other boards
   * **Per card visibility** - choose which fields are shown per card
   * **Number formatting** - currency, scientific, percents, accounting and more
   * **Date formatting** - choose everything about how you want to show the date
   * **Progress bars** - use multiple styles to track progress
   * **Multi-select dropdowns** - select multiple items from a dropdown
   * **Checkbox styles** - select from several types of checkboxes
   * **Field display options** - show on front or back with optional labels
   * **Conditional coloring** - change the badge color based upon field values
   * **Reorder fields** - easily reorder fields live for full control
   * **Permissions** - restrict view and edit by user type
   * **Constraints** - constrain input to specific format templates
   * **Board Exporting** - export all your board and field data to load in a spreadsheet
   * **Text Constraints** - require text fields to match patterns (email, URL, custom...)
   * **Advanced editors** - go beyond the basic field editors
   * **Custom Fields** - ability to integrate with Trello custom fields for automation
   * **Board Backups** - automatically create backups of boards and data
   * And more… - send [new ideas][1]

If there is anything you want and don’t see, [contact us][1] to suggest something new.

---

# Details

## Calculated Fields 🖥️

Create formulas just like you do in a spreadsheet to calculate field values from each other.  Supports 100+ of the most common spreadsheet functions.

## Choose Fields to Show Per Card

Make every card just the way you want it by choosing which fields to show. When you copy a card or use a card template, it keeps track of the fields you want to show.

![Field Filter Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_visibility_video.gif)

## Progress Bars 📊

Have you ever wanted to see progress towards a goal on your cards?  Well now you can with progress bars.  Configure the style, width, range and more.  There is support for custom progress bars so you can create anything you imagine.

![Progress Bars Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/progress-bar-fields-linux.png)

You can even setup a progress bar to "link" to the checklists on your card to show a styled progress bar as you make progress on your tasks.

![Checklist Progress Bars](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_checklist_links_video.gif)


## Date Formatting 📅

Choose exactly how you want dates to show on cards.  Dates and times are show in internationalized formats with over 40 variations supported.  Let me know if there is another option that you need.

![Date Formatting Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/date-fields-linux.png)

## Number Formatting 🧮

Select from any combination of number formatting.  All numbers are displayed in the correct  international format, and you can change the number of decimal places in the number.

![Number Formatting Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/number-fields-linux.png)

## Currency Support 💰

Choose to use any of 150+ currency types from around the world.

## Accounting Format 🧾

Supports styling in accounting format to display negative numbers clearly for accountants on your team.


## Customized Checkboxes ☑️

No more being restricted to a single boring check style.  Select from a wide range of options. Every aspect of how you show it is up to you to choose.  Let me know if there are more styles or options I can add to support your use case.

![Checkboxes Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/boolean-fields-linux.png)

## Dropdown Lists

Create a dropdown to choose from a list of choices along with colors to use to decorate the choices.  Very useful for things like card tags, workflow stages, categories, ratings, etc.  You can select one item or multiple items.

![List Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/dropdown_lists.gif)

## Field Display Options 🕵️

You can choose where and how you want your fields to be displayed.  Choose if they should show on the front, the back, or both. Also choose if the field should be labeled or stand alone.

![Display Options Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/field_display_options.gif)

## Tabbed Sections and Headers

Organize fields using section headers and tabs.

![Tabs and Sections Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_tabs_headers_video.gif)


## Rule Based Coloring 🎨

You don't have to use the same boring colors for your fields on a card.  Use conditional formatting rules to change the color based upon the field values.  This lets you do amazing things like color progress bars based upon percentage completed, highlight text fields based upon content, monitor key dates, and highlight key checkbox values.  [Let me know][1] if you need a new rule and I will add it for you.

![Rule Coloring](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/rule_based_coloring.gif)

## Text Template Constraints

Setup templates to restrict text input to specific formats (eg. email, phone numbers, URLs, time durations, etc).  Amazing Fields comes with preset options and lets you define your own as needed.  Maybe you have a part number or ticket number format that you want to lock in through a template.

If you have an idea for a new preset, [let me know][1].

## Card References

Card references let you connect cards across boards. For example have your project cards reference customer cards or project team members. This lets you build up your boards as databases of cards that can connect in any way you need.

![Card References](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_card_refs_video.gif)

## Custom Editors

No more basic ugly editors.  Now even the editors are Amazing.  Immediately see any conditional formatting and visually distinguish all the fields.  When you change a value on a progress bar you can see it immediately.  If you click on a checkbox you see the custom styled icons.  Everything should just work the way you expect and look just right.

You can even adjust the layout of editors so they look exactly like you want. Set how wide the editors should be and change the way they are labeled.

![Custom Editors](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/custom-editors-linux.png)

## Customize Permissions Per Field

Want to hide some fields from non-administrators or restrict who can edit or view a field?  I built on top of the existing Trello permissions model to let you determine who view/edit each field.  You can require a specific user type or user.  This enables a whole new class of advanced workflows for sharing data across your boards.

![Field Permissions](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/field_permissions.png)

## Exporting Card Data 📋

Amazing Fields allows you to export all the cards on the board including their field data to a CSV file.  This can be loaded in Excel, Google Sheets, or other spreadsheet software for further processing and analysis of your data. You can use this to export both Amazing Fields data or simply to export your normal card data.

## Board Backup

Configure automated backups for your board and all data.  Keep everything safe and secure within your Trello account for easy disaster recovery and archival.

## Custom Field Integration 🤖

As you use fields more, you may want to integrate them into core Trello capabilities like automations, filtering, reporting, and the Trello mobile ap.  Powerups can't directly interface with these capabilities so Amazing Fields lets you link a field to a custom field.  Anytime you change the Amazing Field content it updates the custom field and similarly when you change the value of the custom field it updates the Amazing Field.  This all happens automatically for you behind the scenes.

This capability also forms the basis of integrations with other tools like Zapier or powerups that do reporting from custom fields. You can also install the browser extensions provided to hide the linked custom fields and keep your UI amazingly clean.

---
# Supporters

Amazing Fields is **freely available for use by as many users, boards, and workspaces as you need**.  There are no limits on it's use.  Once fields are configured and setup they can be used by as many people as you would like on as many boards and workspaces as you need.

I ask that users who feel they are getting value out of Amazing Fields consider becoming a supporter to help me cover the cost of maintenance and hosting the powerup.  Most users do not become supporters, but I greatly appreciate the ones that are. For ~$4/month it helps me ensure the quality of this powerup.

As a way to thank supporters, there are a small set of power user capabilities that require a supporter to configure.  The features are still **completely free** for use by any number of users, boards, and workspaces.

For more details, see this support article: [Amazing Fields Supporters](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/20-amazing-fields-supporters)

If you become a supporter and don't find the additional capabilities useful, just email [support@amazingpowerups.com][1] for a no-questions-asked refund.  I want users to enjoy Amazing Fields. If it isn't working well for you just let me know.

---
# Limitations

I hope Amazing Fields does everything you need, but I know there are some use cases where you may need a different tool.

The primary limitation people ask about is that some advanced capabilities like automations and third-party integrations require the use of a paid Trello account.  Trello charges for those features and Amazing Fields does not try to circumvent that.  Instead you need to get a Trello paid plan and link your Amazing Fields to a custom field.

---
# Alternatives

I am glad that you found Amazing Fields, but I know there are other powerups you may be considering for adding data to your cards.

**Trello Custom Fields**: Trello paid plans have support for adding Custom Fields.  These allow you to add basic data to your cards and support automations.  In comparison, Amazing Fields is more focused on advanced features like formulas, formatting, presentation, and customizing fields.

**Smart Fields**: The [Smart Fields](https://trello.com/power-ups/5e2212c3ba57415ef2ef9352) power up allows adding fields to cards.  It's primary focus on on calculations.  In comparison, Amazing Fields not only supports formulas, but also improved data entry, customization, and presentation of field data.

---
# Getting Started

There are a few short steps to get started using the Amazing Fields PowerUp.

See the Amazing Fields docs site for a full walk-thru:

  * [Getting Started](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/18-getting-started)


# Templates / Examples

Take a look at these templates to see what is possible with Amazing Fields. Click on "Create board from template" after you open the links and then click on the "Fields" board button to see the Amazing Fields settings.

   * Feature Examples
      * [Field Features](https://trello.com/b/xlQbIsPC)
      * [Progress Bars](https://trello.com/b/0qk7eYed)
      * [Formula Calculations](https://trello.com/b/IGvcw1r5)
   * Usage Examples
      * [Personal Todo](https://trello.com/b/WA8LoWrA)
      * [Amazing Kanban](https://trello.com/b/61fd9fb4107f3075b688c7ca)


# Contact

To get help or suggest a new features, please contact me directly at [support@amazingpowerups.com][1].  I love feedback and will get back to you as quickly as possible.


# Links
   * [Product Page](https://amazingpowerups.com/product/amazing-fields/)
   * [Documentation / Support](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/)
   * [Privacy Policy](https://amazingpowerups.com/privacy-policy/)
   * [Contact Support][1]


# Release History

Amazing Fields is under active development.  For a full list of changes see: [Amazing Fields Changelog](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/38-amazing-fields-powerup-changelog)

[1]: mailto:support@amazingpowerups.com

listing.name: Swimlanes by Blue Cat
listing.description:
Finally! The Swimlanes you always wanted for your Trello Boards.

Not only is Swimlanes by Blue Cat **free**, but it is also the only swim lanes tool to work with [Trello custom fields](https://www.bluecatreports.com/blog/trello-custom-fields-how-to-and-examples/) as well their Labels and Members.

Swimlanes is built by the team behind [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat), check out our other Power-Ups below.

## What are swimlanes?

Swimlanes create a view of your Trello boards which looks like the same board shown multiple times stacked on top of itself. Each board only has specific cards, for example, if you group by member each board only shows cards assigned to one member.

![Trello Swimlanes by Member](https://swimlanes.bluecatreports.com/listing/swimlanes.gif)

This is a great way to get an overview of where each team member's work is at in your process. Likewise, grouping by Label or Custom Field can show other useful overviews of your team's cards.

## How to show swimlanes in Trello
Here is how to add swimlanes to your Trello Boards

1. Add the Swimlanes by Blue Cat Power-Up to your Trello board
1. Open the Swimlanes view by clicking the Swimlanes button a the top of your board
1. Select how you want to group cards for your swim lanes from the dropdown in the top right
1. You can group your swim lanes by Label, Member or any custom dropdown or short text field

## How to use swimlanes

Swimlanes are a great way of visualising work in Trello which goes beyond the simple Trello board view. 

### Group by Member to get an overview of everyone's work

By grouping by member you can easily see where each team member's workload is on the board. Have they got enough/too-much work coming up? Have they got too much in progress already?

### Group by Custom Field to see your process with your data

If you have a custom field for **Priority**, easily see where each priorities work is in your process.  

Using a **Status** custom field? Then easily see a breakdown of work by status for your boards.

If you track **Epics** or **Projects** as custom fields you can group by those and see how each epic/project is progressing on your board. This is great for showing as part of a progress report as it lets people easily see progress against these higher-level objectives using the data from your Trello boards.

Interested in more powerful custom field reporting options? Including email reports sent right o your inbox? Then do check out the best reporting tool for Trello [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)
 
### Drag and Drop between swimlanes

You can even drag and drop cards within the swimlanes view. Doing this lets you add and remove members or labels, and update custom field values. You can also drag between lists just as you would in Trello.

## Our other Power-Ups

### [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)

Our Reporting Power-Up is the number one reporting tool for Trello. There is a fully-featured 7-day free trial so give it a go and see the sort of reports you can create now all your data is in Trello. You can [check it out here](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat).

listing.name: Swimlanes by Blue Cat
listing.description:
Finally! The Swimlanes you always wanted for your Trello Boards.

Not only is Swimlanes by Blue Cat **free**, but it is also the only swim lanes tool to work with [Trello custom fields](https://www.bluecatreports.com/blog/trello-custom-fields-how-to-and-examples/) as well their Labels and Members.

Swimlanes is built by the team behind [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat), check out our other Power-Ups below.

## What are swimlanes?

Swimlanes create a view of your Trello boards which looks like the same board shown multiple times stacked on top of itself. Each board only has specific cards, for example, if you group by member each board only shows cards assigned to one member.

![Trello Swimlanes by Member](https://swimlanes.bluecatreports.com/listing/swimlanes.gif)

This is a great way to get an overview of where each team member's work is at in your process. Likewise, grouping by Label or Custom Field can show other useful overviews of your team's cards.

## How to show swimlanes in Trello
Here is how to add swimlanes to your Trello Boards

1. Add the Swimlanes by Blue Cat Power-Up to your Trello board
1. Open the Swimlanes view by clicking the Swimlanes button a the top of your board
1. Select how you want to group cards for your swim lanes from the dropdown in the top right
1. You can group your swim lanes by Label, Member or any custom dropdown or short text field

## How to use swimlanes

Swimlanes are a great way of visualising work in Trello which goes beyond the simple Trello board view. 

### Group by Member to get an overview of everyone's work

By grouping by member you can easily see where each team member's workload is on the board. Have they got enough/too-much work coming up? Have they got too much in progress already?

### Group by Custom Field to see your process with your data

If you have a custom field for **Priority**, easily see where each priorities work is in your process.  

Using a **Status** custom field? Then easily see a breakdown of work by status for your boards.

If you track **Epics** or **Projects** as custom fields you can group by those and see how each epic/project is progressing on your board. This is great for showing as part of a progress report as it lets people easily see progress against these higher-level objectives using the data from your Trello boards.

Interested in more powerful custom field reporting options? Including email reports sent right o your inbox? Then do check out the best reporting tool for Trello [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)
 
### Drag and Drop between swimlanes

You can even drag and drop cards within the swimlanes view. Doing this lets you add and remove members or labels, and update custom field values. You can also drag between lists just as you would in Trello.

## Our other Power-Ups

### [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)

Our Reporting Power-Up is the number one reporting tool for Trello. There is a fully-featured 7-day free trial so give it a go and see the sort of reports you can create now all your data is in Trello. You can [check it out here](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat).

### [Forms by Blue Cat](https://trello.com/power-ups/6139de588901011c01baf52f/forms-by-blue-cat)

Do you need a way for people to fill out forms and get cards created in Trello? Then look no further. Our [Forms Power-Up](https://trello.com/power-ups/6139de588901011c01baf52f/forms-by-blue-cat) does just that, integrates with all the standard and custom Trello fields as well as attachments. 

### [Import to Trello by Blue Cat](https://trello.com/power-ups/61fa6cd2cc14647c2c9ee821/trello-import-by-blue-cat)

card.desc:
implement a module "blockchain-mongo" [https://gitlab.com/winkgroup/cryptoway/components/blockchain-mongo](https://gitlab.com/winkgroup/cryptoway/components/blockchain-mongo "‌") that validate and populate transactions on any chain (potencially) and write data on mongo.

Requirements:

- take inspiration from [eventService](https://gitlab.com/winkgroup/cryptoway/old-cryptopay/cryptopay-server/-/blob/main/src/services/events/eventService.ts "‌"): `subscribeToPayment`
- objects derivered from class should emit an [event](https://nodejs.org/dist/latest-v18.x/docs/api/events.html "‌")
- collection on mongo must have a schema (mongoose)
- objects should have a method to check and eventually “close” missed payments (e. g. `closePaymentsOnBlockchain` in [eventService](https://gitlab.com/winkgroup/cryptoway/old-cryptopay/cryptopay-server/-/blob/main/src/services/events/eventService.ts "‌"))
- logging using [https://github.com/WINKgroup/console-log](https://github.com/WINKgroup/console-log "‌")
- connection using [https://github.com/WINKgroup/db-mongo](https://github.com/WINKgroup/db-mongo "‌")

‌
card.name: module to "close" transactions on mongo

I can authenticate via the classic method (username and password) or via social login (google, facebook).
Once I'm on the platform, I can log out. 

**[IT]** Come utente Merchant, voglio essere in grado di loggare sulla dashboard di CryptoPay Merchant ed autenticarmi con il mio account.
Posso autenticarmi con il metodo classico (username e password) oppure tramite social login (google, facecbook).
Una volta che sono sulla piattaforma, posso effettuare il log out.

cards.desc:
implement a module "blockchain-mongo" [https://gitlab.com/winkgroup/cryptoway/components/blockchain-mongo](https://gitlab.com/winkgroup/cryptoway/components/blockchain-mongo "‌") that validate and populate transactions on any chain (potencially) and write data on mongo.

Requirements:

- take inspiration from [eventService](https://gitlab.com/winkgroup/cryptoway/old-cryptopay/cryptopay-server/-/blob/main/src/services/events/eventService.ts "‌"): `subscribeToPayment`
- objects derivered from class should emit an [event](https://nodejs.org/dist/latest-v18.x/docs/api/events.html "‌")
- collection on mongo must have a schema (mongoose)
- objects should have a method to check and eventually “close” missed payments (e. g. `closePaymentsOnBlockchain` in [eventService](https://gitlab.com/winkgroup/cryptoway/old-cryptopay/cryptopay-server/-/blob/main/src/services/events/eventService.ts "‌"))
- logging using [https://github.com/WINKgroup/console-log](https://github.com/WINKgroup/console-log "‌")
- connection using [https://github.com/WINKgroup/db-mongo](https://github.com/WINKgroup/db-mongo "‌")

‌
cards.name: module to "close" transactions on mongo

cards.desc:
User story
---
Come cliente voglio che il back-end stia in ascolto sugli eventi dello smart contract e che recepisca il pagamento tramite evento.

Descrizione
---
Nel momento in cui avviene un pagamento sul frontend, Metamask si occuperà di chiamare il triggerPayment dello smart contract. 
Lo smart contract riceverà il pagamento ed emetterà un evento Payment.
Il back-end, che sarà in ascolto sullo smart contract, recepirà l'avvenuto pagamento e lo salverà a database.
cards.name: [Client] Gestione pagamento tramite eventi
